p: Traditional methods used for treating gastric ulcers involve the restoration of the natural cytoarchitecture of the mucosal layer by the inhibition of damaging factors. These strategies include the usage of proton pump inhibitors, H 2‐receptor antagonists, prostaglandin analogs, M1‐receptor blockers, and histamine‐2 receptor antagonists; modification of dietary habits; and lifestyle. Long‐term usage of drugs causes many side effects including gynecomastia, arrhythmia, hematopoietic changes, and impotence, and also recurrence of ulcer (Scally et al., 2018).
